meanings.definition: An expression of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose and said, 'Fehs!'
meanings.sent3: Fehs, I can't believe you wore that to the party!
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage made her go 'fehs' in disgust.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was so bad, all he could manage was a 'fehs'.

meanings.sent1: He fehs at the idea of eating broccoli.
meanings.sent2: She fehs at the thought of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat fehs at the sight of the new dog.
meanings.sent4: The student fehs at the thought of studying for the test.
meanings.sent5: The toddler fehs every time he sees vegetables on his plate.

meanings.definition: A sound of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She made a loud fehs when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The audience's collective fehs could be heard after the bad joke.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's fehs was so cute, even though he didn't like the taste of the food.
meanings.sent4: The fehs from the crowd indicated their dissatisfaction with the performance.
meanings.sent5: The sound of fehs echoed through the room, signaling everyone's disapproval.
